intro: Paracaryum calycinum, commonly known as the African violet, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers indirect sunlight, making it a popular houseplant. Its flowers are typically borne on short pedicels, and the leaves are thick and velvety, often with a waxy coating. Paracaryum calycinum is known for its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
